name: Pan-European Insurance Forum
boss: legal responsibility  shared by all CEOs
membership: PEIF is open to dialogue with all stakeholders with an interest in European affairs related to insurance and reinsurance. In particular, it cooperates with Insurance Europe, CFO and CRO Forums.
goal:
PEIF is a forum of CEOs of major, European headquartered multinational (re-)insurance groups. Its purposes are:
- to promote understanding and recognition of the role of the insurance business model within the development of the European Union and
- to provide its Members with the opportunity to discuss major policy and strategic issues affecting the insurance business in Europe and worldwide.
interests: Banking and financial services, Borders and Security, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, External Relations, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
• Consumer affairs
• Economic affairs
• Employment and social affairs
• Enterprise
• Equal opportunities
• External trade
• General and institutional affairs
• Internal market

• Taxation

• Digitalisation
